text: Troops, sometimes mounted and sometimes afoot, left the post daily for
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: what I assumed to be patrol duty.  I judged the little force of a
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: thousand men were detailed here to maintain the authority of a distant
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: government in a conquered country.  Later, I learned that my surmise
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was correct, and this was but one of a great chain of similar posts
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that dotted the new frontier of the black nation into whose hands I had
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fallen.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Slowly I learned their tongue, so that I could understand what was said
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: before me, and make myself understood.  I had seen from the first that
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I was being treated as a slave--that all whites that fell into the
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hands of the blacks were thus treated.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Almost daily new prisoners were brought in, and about three weeks after
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I was brought in to the post a troop of cavalry came from the south to
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: relieve one of the troops stationed there.  There was great jubilation
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in the encampment after the arrival of the newcomers, old friendships
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were renewed and new ones made.  But the happiest men were those of the
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: troop that was to be relieved.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The next morning they started away, and as they were forced upon the
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: parade ground we prisoners were marched from our quarters and lined up
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: before them.  A couple of long chains were brought, with rings in the
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: links every few feet.  At first I could not guess the purpose of these
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: chains.  But I was soon to learn.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: A couple of soldiers snapped the first ring around the neck of a
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: powerful white slave, and one by one the rest of us were herded to our
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: places, and the work of shackling us neck to neck commenced.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The colonel stood watching the procedure.  Presently his eyes fell upon
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me, and he spoke to a young officer at his side.  The latter stepped
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: toward me and motioned me to follow him.  I did so, and was led back to
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the colonel.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: By this time I could understand a few words of their strange language,
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and when the colonel asked me if I would prefer to remain at the post
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as his body servant, I signified my willingness as emphatically as
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: possible, for I had seen enough of the brutality of the common soldiers
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: toward their white slaves to have no desire to start out upon a march
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of unknown length, chained by the neck, and driven on by the great
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: whips that a score of the soldiers carried to accelerate the speed of
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: their charges.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: About three hundred prisoners who had been housed in six prisons at the
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: post marched out of the gates that morning, toward what fate and what
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: future I could not guess.  Neither had the poor devils themselves more
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: than the most vague conception of what lay in store for them, except
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that they were going elsewhere to continue in the slavery that they had
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: known since their capture by their black conquerors--a slavery that was
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to continue until death released them.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: My position was altered at the post.  From working about the
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: headquarters office, I was transferred to the colonel's living
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: quarters.  I had greater freedom, and no longer slept in one of the
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: prisons, but had a little room to myself off the kitchen of the
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: colonel's log house.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: My master was always kind to me, and under him I rapidly learned the
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: language of my captors, and much concerning them that had been a
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mystery to me before.  His name was Abu Belik.  He was a colonel in the
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cavalry of Abyssinia, a country of which I do not remember ever
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hearing, but which Colonel Belik assured me is the oldest civilized
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: country in the world.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Colonel Belik was born in Adis Abeba, the capital of the empire, and
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: until recently had been in command of the emperor's palace guard.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Jealousy and the ambition and intrigue of another officer had lost him
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the favor of his emperor, and he had been detailed to this frontier
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: post as a mark of his sovereign's displeasure.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Some fifty years before, the young emperor, Menelek XIV, was ambitious.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He knew that a great world lay across the waters far to the north of
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: his capital.  Once he had crossed the desert and looked out upon the
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: blue sea that was the northern boundary of his dominions.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: There lay another world to conquer.  Menelek busied himself with the
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: building of a great fleet, though his people were not a maritime race.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: His army crossed into Europe.  It met with little resistance, and for
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fifty years his soldiers had been pushing his boundaries farther and
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: farther toward the north.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "The yellow men from the east and north are contesting our rights here
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: now," said the colonel, "but we shall win--we shall conquer the world,
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: carrying Christianity to all the benighted heathen of Europe, and Asia
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as well."
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "You are a Christian people?" I asked.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He looked at me in surprise, nodding his head affirmatively.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I am a Christian," I said.  "My people are the most powerful on earth."
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He smiled, and shook his head indulgently, as a father to a child who
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sets up his childish judgment against that of his elders.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Then I set out to prove my point.  I told him of our cities, of our
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: army, of our great navy.  He came right back at me asking for figures,
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and when he was done I had to admit that only in our navy were we
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: numerically superior.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Menelek XIV is the undisputed ruler of all the continent of Africa, of
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: all of ancient Europe except the British Isles, Scandinavia, and
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: eastern Russia, and has large possessions and prosperous colonies in
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: what once were Arabia and Turkey in Asia.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He has a standing army of ten million men, and his people possess
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: slaves--white slaves--to the number of ten or fifteen million.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Colonel Belik was much surprised, however, upon his part to learn of
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the great nation which lay across the ocean, and when he found that I
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was a naval officer, he was inclined to accord me even greater
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: consideration than formerly.  It was difficult for him to believe my
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: assertion that there were but few blacks in my country, and that these
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: occupied a lower social plane than the whites.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Just the reverse is true in Colonel Belik's land.  He considered whites
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: inferior beings, creatures of a lower order, and assuring me that even
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the few white freemen of Abyssinia were never accorded anything
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: approximating a position of social equality with the blacks.  They live
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in the poorer districts of the cities, in little white colonies, and a
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: black who marries a white is socially ostracized.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The arms and ammunition of the Abyssinians are greatly inferior to
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ours, yet they are tremendously effective against the ill-armed
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: barbarians of Europe.  Their rifles are of a type similar to the
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: magazine rifles of twentieth century Pan-America, but carrying only
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: five cartridges in the magazine, in addition to the one in the chamber.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: They are of extraordinary length, even those of the cavalry, and are of
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: extreme accuracy.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The Abyssinians themselves are a fine looking race of black men--tall,
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: muscular, with fine teeth, and regular features, which incline
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: distinctly toward Semitic mold--I refer to the full-blooded natives of
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Abyssinia.  They are the patricians--the aristocracy.  The army is
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: officered almost exclusively by them.  Among the soldiery a lower type
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of negro predominates, with thicker lips and broader, flatter noses.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: These men are recruited, so the colonel told me, from among the
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: conquered tribes of Africa.  They are good soldiers--brave and loyal.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: They can read and write, and they are endowed with a self-confidence
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and pride which, from my readings of the words of ancient African
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: explorers, must have been wanting in their earliest progenitors.  On
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the whole, it is apparent that the black race has thrived far better in
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the past two centuries under men of its own color than it had under the
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: domination of whites during all previous history.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I had been a prisoner at the little frontier post for over a month,
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: when orders came to Colonel Belik to hasten to the eastern frontier
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with the major portion of his command, leaving only one troop to
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: garrison the fort.  As his body servant, I accompanied him mounted upon
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a fiery little Abyssinian pony.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We marched rapidly for ten days through the heart of the ancient German
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: empire, halting when night found us in proximity to water.  Often we
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: passed small posts similar to that at which the colonel's regiment had
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: been quartered, finding in each instance that only a single company or
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: troop remained for defence, the balance having been withdrawn toward
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the northeast, in the same direction in which we were moving.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Naturally, the colonel had not confided to me the nature of his orders.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: But the rapidity of our march and the fact that all available troops
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were being hastened toward the northeast assured me that a matter of
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: vital importance to the dominion of Menelek XIV in that part of Europe
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was threatening or had already broken.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I could not believe that a simple rising of the savage tribes of whites
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: would necessitate the mobilizing of such a force as we presently met
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with converging from the south into our trail.  There were large bodies
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of cavalry and infantry, endless streams of artillery wagons and guns,
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and countless horse-drawn covered vehicles laden with camp equipage,
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: munitions, and provisions.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Here, for the first time, I saw camels, great caravans of them, bearing
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: all sorts of heavy burdens, and miles upon miles of elephants doing
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: similar service.  It was a scene of wondrous and barbaric splendor, for
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the men and beasts from the south were gaily caparisoned in rich
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: colors, in marked contrast to the gray uniformed forces of the
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: frontier, with which I had been familiar.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The rumor reached us that Menelek himself was coming, and the pitch of
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: excitement to which this announcement raised the troops was little
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: short of miraculous--at least, to one of my race and nationality whose
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rulers for centuries had been but ordinary men, holding office at the
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: will of the people for a few brief years.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As I witnessed it, I could not but speculate upon the moral effect upon
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: his troops of a sovereign's presence in the midst of battle.  All else
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: being equal in war between the troops of a republic and an empire,
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: could not this exhilarated mental state, amounting almost to hysteria
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: on the part of the imperial troops, weigh heavily against the soldiers
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of a president?  I wonder.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: But if the emperor chanced to be absent?  What then? Again I wonder.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: On the eleventh day we reached our destination--a walled frontier city
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of about twenty thousand.  We passed some lakes, and crossed some old
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: canals before entering the gates.  Within, beside the frame buildings,
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were many built of ancient brick and well-cut stone.  These, I was
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: told, were of material taken from the ruins of the ancient city which,
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: once, had stood upon the site of the present town.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The name of the town, translated from the Abyssinian, is New Gondar.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It stands, I am convinced, upon the ruins of ancient Berlin, the one
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: time capital of the old German empire, but except for the old building
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: material used in the new town there is no sign of the former city.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The day after we arrived, the town was gaily decorated with flags,
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: streamers, gorgeous rugs, and banners, for the rumor had proved
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: true--the emperor was coming.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Colonel Belik had accorded me the greatest liberty, permitting me to go
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: where I pleased, after my few duties had been performed.  As a result
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of his kindness, I spent much time wandering about New Gondar, talking
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with the inhabitants, and exploring the city of black men.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As I had been given a semi-military uniform which bore insignia
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: indicating that I was an officer's body servant, even the blacks
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: treated me with a species of respect, though I could see by their
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: manner that I was really as the dirt beneath their feet.  They answered
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my questions civilly enough, but they would not enter into conversation
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with me.  It was from other slaves that I learned the gossip of the
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: city.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Troops were pouring in from the west and south, and pouring out toward
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the east.  I asked an old slave who was sweeping the dirt into little
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: piles in the gutters of the street where the soldiers were going.  He
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: looked at me in surprise.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Why, to fight the yellow men, of course," he said.  "They have crossed
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the border, and are marching toward New Gondar."
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Who will win?" I asked.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He shrugged his shoulders.  "Who knows?" he said.  "I hope it will be
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the yellow men, but Menelek is powerful--it will take many yellow men
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to defeat him."
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Crowds were gathering along the sidewalks to view the emperor's entry
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: into the city.  I took my place among them, although I hate crowds, and
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I am glad that I did, for I witnessed such a spectacle of barbaric
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: splendor as no other Pan-American has ever looked upon.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Down the broad main thoroughfare, which may once have been the historic
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Unter den Linden, came a brilliant cortege.  At the head rode a
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: regiment of red-coated hussars--enormous men, black as night.  There
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were troops of riflemen mounted on camels.  The emperor rode in a
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: golden howdah upon the back of a huge elephant so covered with rich
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hangings and embellished with scintillating gems that scarce more than
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the beast's eyes and feet were visible.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Menelek was a rather gross-looking man, well past middle age, but he
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: carried himself with an air of dignity befitting one descended in
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: unbroken line from the Prophet--as was his claim.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: His eyes were bright but crafty, and his features denoted both
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sensuality and cruelness.  In his youth he may have been a rather fine
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: looking black, but when I saw him his appearance was revolting--to me,
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: at least.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: branches of the service, among them batteries of field guns mounted on
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: elephants.
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: In the center of the troops following the imperial elephant marched a
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: great caravan of slaves.  The old street sweeper at my elbow told me
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the commanding officers of the frontier posts.  The majority of them

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: his sentiments, I was as powerless to alter their destinies as he.

text: always, from the south and west, but always toward the east.  Each new
title: The Lost Continent
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: brought rugs and ornaments and jewels; from the west, slaves; for the
